features: [All Types of Cookware]-CUSIMAX Hot Plate is suitable for all type of cookware. Compatible with pots and pans with maximum size of 7.1 inches. Works with glass and aluminum and heats cookware efficiently with minimal heat loss.

[1500W & Easy Cooking]-CUSIMAX Hot Plates used 7 thermostatically controlled heat settings conveniently to cook a variety of foods such as warm sauces, decoct steak, grilled cheese, boil water, make soup, cook pasta and vegetables and do so much more. Meet your daily cooking needs. You can easily complete a whole day's meals on one machine!

[Convenient Single Burner]-The small scale in size makes it very portable. Ideal for dorm rooms, offices, camping, or even your RV. Great for every day use or as an extra cooking appliance in a busy kitchen. No stovetop required.

[Safety & Durable]-Silver Stainless steel body built to withstand frequent use. Simply wipe with a clean and damp cloth when cool. Durable cast iron cooktop. Automatic safety shutoff function with temperature regulated by a thermostat.

[Customer Service]-CUSIMAX offer a outstanding 30-day hassle-free return policy. With free Lifetime Customer Service, please contact us with any issues so that we can resolve them or replace your product. (Note: It is normal the machine will get hot because it has higher calorific value when it works.The heating light may cycle on and off during operation.)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: CUSIMAX hot plate is a good helper for your cooking, providing cooking flexibility for your kitchen! When your kitchen is going to be renovated, or you just moved to a new house, or when you need an extra burner at a party as an alternative kitchen burner to entertain a large group of people, the Cusimax hot plate is the perfect choice. Compared with the induction cooker, the hot plate has no electromagnetic radiation and is harmless to the body. Pregnant women do not need to worry. The smooth stainless steel surface is easy to clean. Allow it to cool for 30 minutes after use, and then just wipe it with a rag. All these troubles are a piece of cake for our Cusimax hot plate. No matter where you are, as long as you can plug in a 120V power supply, it can meet your various cooking needs, compatible for use in all homes.

Easy Cooking Electric Hot Plate 120V 1500W 60HzNo Electromagnetic RadiationSuitable with All Types of CookwareEquipped with 7 Thermostatically Controlled Heat SettingsNo NoiseEquipped with Thermal Fuse for Overheating ProtectionHigh Quality Cast Iron Plate

The silver stainless steel body is durable and suitable for your daily use. Whether it is a stainless steel pot, iron wok, aluminum pot, ceramic pot, or even glass cookware, it can be compatible. This Hot Plate is powerful enough to use as an additional solid burner to warm sauces, cook soup, boil water, cook pasta, and vegetables and do so much more. Cook your favorite food just like a normal stove. The compact size is easy to store and saves space. It is suitable for use in different scenarios, such as office, RV, small apartment, basement, or attic, and even you can take it on your travels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well, heat up a little slow.
reviews.reviewText: I needed a hot plate occasionally as an extra heating surface for meals. I chose this one because of the wattage (1500).Everything works as expected, though the numbers on the knobs are little hard to read in bright light though, at least they are if you have a bit of issue with close up reading.The heating element does heat up, though it takes a little longer to boil water than on my induction stove top. This is not a flaw, and is to be expected from an item that is being used as an "extra heating surface".Overall, this is a good hot plate, not heavy at all and easy to pick up and move so it will also work well for travel.Easy to clean, too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great makes no sound
reviews.reviewText: The outside metal gets extremely hot and will burn if you touch. It takes a long time to cool down to touch after cooking. The metal seems like tin and not heavy duty but cooks good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great product......with hot knobs
reviews.reviewText: This is a very nice product.......it heats up nice and fast, and works well. I like the look, and the finish. My only gripe is that the on/off knob and the temperature knob get really hot......you will want to use a napkin or tissue to protect your fingers when adjusting the temperature or turning it off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use and a great replacement for a stove!
reviews.reviewText: Temperature control and use is very easy with this burner, we don’t have a stove currently so this does a wonderful job to cook anything that’s needed. In fact, it almost feels like buying a whole stove would be unnecessary! It heats up quickly and is easy to clean, just be sure to let it cool off before you touch or clean it as it remains hot for quite a while.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars it is a good hotplate
reviews.reviewText: during the second use, some grease spattered while frying burgers. i grabbed a paper towel to wipe the grease off the control knobs and the white paint they used to show heat settings simply wiped off the surface.so now it is guesswork as to the temp settings. in spite of this i love the way it heats so quickly and super easy to clean up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good performance but crazy VOCs
reviews.reviewText: This product cooked well and looks sleek but burns off high VOCs. Unless you cook outside or having solid ventilation, I would pass

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heats up great, easy to use!
reviews.reviewText: I had another like this that stopped working, this is replacement. I cook on top of my rollator ( a walker w/ seat) and I got a large plastic cutting board from Amazon to put on seat, then I put that webbed vinyl shelf liner you can buy cheap( it’s to prevent the unit from slipping on the plastic Put the hotplate on it, and go to town! I have done big pots of chili, fried foods, omelette, burgers, chicken cacciatore, you name it! It is wonderful. Note: it only takes a 3 prong( polarized) outlet ..the food tends to cook on to the outer metal surface near the heat when you have a spill and it is NOT easy to clean. I’m sure I can find an easier way to get it off, but I got the red, and since it’s painted it’s at more risk of scratching off

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars There is not much good to say.
reviews.reviewText: They claim it heats up fast and it does if you just heat a spoonful of water as they do in the video. But if you put on a small pot with a couple of quarts of water it takes a long time. With the thermostat (not rheostat) set to max the light was on (indicating the burner was heating) 1/3 of the time so it might as well have been a 500 watt hot plate instead of 1500 watts. When I put it on max I expect it to be on all the time if not most of the time.The burner surface is connected to the body. This is inefficient and makes the whole body and the knobs too hot to touch. Are we trying to heat a pan or the whole room? If you spill or have a boil over the burner surface will rust.The numbers on the knobs are too small plus the on/off lettering is on the sides of the knob where one grips and thus they wore off quickly.I noticed later on that the claim is made that it will keep food warm a long time. The other side of that is that it is extremely slow to respond when the temperature setting is reduced. The way to keep food warm is to set the temperature to warm.I suppose I could say it is nice looking and easy to clean.

My kitchen is under renovation and I haven't had a working stove for a month. I bought this to use in my laundry room/temporary kitchen. It's perfect for the job - it's very stable on the counter and the controls are very clear with a separate on/off and temperature knob; it gets extremely hot for stir frying/or a steak etc if desired or boiling water for pasta; and on a low setting it's suitable for soups or a slow-cooking stew. I placed it on a large baking sheet covered in tin foil to help make any splattering easier to clean up.
